question: Individuals  can  do  nothing  to  improve  the  environment;  only  governments  and large companies can make a difference.To what extent do you agree or disagree?Give  reasons  for  your  answer  and  include  any  relevant  examples  from  your  own knowledge or experience.You should write at least 250words.
text: Only ministries and big organizations can enhance the ecosystem, citizens  cannot do anything. I totally disagree with this view because every taxpayer can participate charity work organized by non-profit foundations as well as they can keep their local community clean and inspire a new generation.

The first reason why I disagree with only government can improve the environment is that a concern and  alert individual  may join a volunteer job  to have a sustainable living place.  There are lots of events all around the year regarding tree plantation, banning of plastic products and reservations of natural habitat. People can participate in these by planting a new tree, using fibre bags and not killing any endanger species. For example, in 2017, local communities in West Bengal State  announced that they will not use any polyethylene products and they will not allow anyone to use them. They had found the positive outcome next year monsoon when there was no blockage in the sewerage and drainage and it had prevented them from flooding. However, a help from the central cabinet will inspire such community to do such work in a big prospect.

Individuals can start to keep their home and are surrounding areas knit and clean by categorizing different types of wastes and throwing it in the proper bins. There are some countries where individuals are so careless to throw wastes on the road and the market place. For instance,  most of the Bangladeshi people do not know how to use recycle bins. If you go to the capital Dhaka, you will smell bad odour even at the entrance of a big shopping mall. Besides, If Bangladeshi residents were cautions about pollution, Bangladesh would get a clean capital and much living place. Nevertheless, the Bangladesh government has invested a lot of money to keep their city clean, but not getting enough help from their people.

In conclusion, every person has a their won liability to keep their society pollution free and government cannot do it alone without the participate of its taxpayers. It is predicted that in the future parliaments, cabinets, big organizations and  people will work together to have a beautiful living planet Earth.
